oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Excerpt 1 from oral history interview with Adolpho Birch, 2005 June 22
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville Civil Rights Movement participant Adolpho A. Birch, conducted on 22 June 2005 by John Egerton as part of the Nashville Public Library's Civil Rights Oral History Project. Birch discusses the Colored YMCA Law School, also known as the Kent College of Law, in Nashville, how the school was established, and some of the other people who attended or taught at the school, including Robert Lillard and Z. Alexander Looby. The complete interview, as well as a transcript, is available in the repository.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Birch, Adolpho A., 1932- --Interviews; Looby, Z. Alexander (Zephaniah Alexander), 1899- ; Lillard, Robert Emmitt, 1907-1991
Kent College of Law (Nashville, Tenn.); Young Men's Christian Association
